ctrlClassName.description: Returns the class name of a Control as it is defined in config. If you need config class of a game created Display, it is stored on display itself: _className = findDisplay 12 getVariable ["BIS_fnc_initDisplay_configClass", ""]; // "RscDiary"
ctrlClassName.example: List class names of all controls present on display 46:_return = [] ; { _return pushBack format ["IDC: %1, className: %2", ctrlIDC _x, ctrlClassName _x]; } forEach (allControls (findDisplay 46)); copyToClipboard (_return joinString endl);

ctrlCreate.description: Creates a new control in the given display. The control class could be existing class from main config or custom class defined in mission config (mission config is searched first). Some of the common controls defined in main config that can be used with this command:

ctrlDelete.description: Deletes given control. The control has to be created either by script with ctrlCreate or to have deletable property in config set to true. Use ctrlShow false and ctrlEnable false to disable controls that cannot be deleted. Returns Boolean indicating whether the deletion was successful.

getCargoIndex.description: Returns index of the unit in cargo. 0,1,2... or -1 if not in cargo.
getCargoIndex.example: player moveInCargo heli; hint str (heli getCargoIndex player);

lockCameraTo.description: Lock/Unlock stabilized camera (in vanilla used currently only for UAVs) to target.

pushBack.description: Insert an element to the back of the given array. This command modifies the original array. (see also: pushBackUnique)

setTimeMultiplier.description: Sets a time multiplier for in-game time. The command range is now capped at 0.1 - 120 to avoid performance problems.

timeMultiplier.description: Returns the value set with setTimeMultiplier.

vectorFromTo.description: Unit vector, equal to direction from vector1 to vector2. In other words this command produces normalised vector between given 2 points. To get a normal vector use vectorDiff.

vectorNormalized.description: Returns normalized vector (unit vector, vectorMagnitude == 1) of given vector. If given vector is 0 result is a 0 vector as well.

addBackpackGlobal.description: Adds a backpack to a unit (even non-local).

addMagazineAmmoCargo.description: Adds magazines with specified ammo count to the cargo space of a vehicle or a container.

addToRemainsCollector.description: Adds an array of vehicles/units to disposal manager for automatic wreck/body removal. The disposal manager follows wreck/body removal values set in description.ext

addWeaponTurret.description: Adds a weapon to the turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

BIS_fnc_setMissionStatusSlot.description: Set a slot for mission status with sectors, respawn tickets, etc.
BIS_fnc_setMissionStatusSlot.docSyntax: [id, text, texture, color, fade, position, barHeight] call BIS_fnc_setMissionStatusSlot

BIS_fnc_showMissionStatus.description: Show mission status with sectors, respawn tickets, etc.

ctrlModel.description: Returns model used in 3D Arma: GUI Configuration.

ctrlModelDirAndUp.description: Returns vectorDir and vectorUp of the model used in 3D Arma: GUI Configuration.

ctrlSetModel.description: Sets model for 3D Arma: GUI Configuration.

ctrlSetModelDirAndUp.description: Sets orientation of 3D control model. It is similar to setVectorDirAndUp command for an object.

deleteAt.description: Removes array element at the given index and returns removed element (modifies the original array, just like resize or set). Will not issue error when -1 index is passed making it ideal for using with find(see Example 2) or findIf(see Example 3) command

deleteRange.description: Removes a range of array elements from the given array (modifies the original array, just like resize or set).

deleteVehicleCrew.description: Deletes a member of the crew of a vehicle. Human players cannot be deleted.

getDirVisual.description: Returns object's heading in the range from 0 to 360 in render time scope.

getHit.description: Returns selection damage. Same as getHitPointDamage, only the argument is selection part instead of hit point.

getPosASLVisual.description: Returns an object's rendered 3D position ASL (z value above sea level) in render time scope. Alias of visiblePositionASL.

getPosATLVisual.description: Returns an object's rendered 3D position ATL (z value above ground) in render time scope.

getPosVisual.description: Returns an object's rendered 3D position (z value above sea when over sea, or above ground when over land) in render time scope. Alias of visiblePosition.

getPosWorld.description: Returns PositionWorld, which is PositionASL of the model centre [0,0,0] of an object, rather than transformed boundingCenter or LandContact vertices.

isCollisionLightOn.description: Returns true if vehicle collision lights are on otherwise false.

isInRemainsCollector.description: Checks if unit or vehicle is queued for disposal after death.
isInRemainsCollector.example: if (isInRemainsCollector unit1) then {hint "unit1 is queued for disposal"};

isLightOn.description: Returns true if vehicle headlights are on otherwise false.

modelToWorldVisual.description: Converts position from object model space to world space in render time scope. For ASL version see modelToWorldVisualWorld.

removeBackpackGlobal.description: Removes backpack from a unit. (even non-local)

removeFromRemainsCollector.description: Removes vehicles/units from the garbage collector, so they do not get deleted automatically; added earlier with addToRemainsCollector

removeWeaponTurret.description: Removes weapon from the turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

scriptNull.description: A non-existing Script or script that has finished (scriptDone). To compare non-existent scripts use isNull or isEqualTo:
scriptNull.example: Wait until previous script is finished before starting a new one:[] spawn { _script = scriptNull; for "_i" from 1 to 10 do { waitUntil {isNull _script}; _script = _i spawn { hint format ["script %1 started", _this]; sleep 1; hint format ["script %1 finished", _this]; sleep 0.2; }; }; };

setCollisionLight.description: Switches collision lights of a vehicle on/off.

setPilotLight.description: Switches headlights of a vehicle on/off. Note that the vehicle has to be local, for global variant use Arma 3 Actions "LightOn"/"LightOff"

setPosWorld.description: Sets position of an object based on PositionWorld, which is PositionASL of the model centre [0,0,0].

turretLocal.description: Checks if a turret is local.

vectorDirVisual.description: Return object's normalized direction vector in world space ([x,y,z]) in render time scope.

vectorUpVisual.description: Return object's up vector in world Position coordinates ( [x, y, z] ) in render time scope.

worldToModelVisual.description: Converts position from world space to object model space in render time scope.

airDensityCurveRTD.description: Returns array with air density data.

airDensityRTD.description: Returns air density in given altitude.

allTurrets.description: Returns array of available turret paths from vehicle object.
allTurrets.example: _turretPaths = allTurrets _mySlammerUP; // [[0],[0,0]] _turretPaths = allTurrets [_mySlammerUP, true]; // [[0],[0,0]] <- Commander turret is also an FFV turret _turretPaths = allTurrets [_mySlammerUP, false]; // [[0]]

BIS_fnc_didJIP.description: Return whether or not the local player joined the game while it was already in progress.
BIS_fnc_didJIP.example: if ([] call BIS_fnc_didJIP) then { forceRespawn player };

BIS_fnc_ffvUpdate.description: Update Firing From Vehicle feature depending on condition defined in turret's config.

canSlingLoad.description: Returns true if setSlingLoad is possible.

clearForcesRTD.description: Removes all force generators from world.

collectiveRTD.description: Returns the current position of a helicopter's collective pitch control.

difficultyEnabledRTD.description: Returns true if Advanced Flight Model is enabled. Forcing of rotorlib simulation could be done with mission param forceRotorLibSimulation

enableAutoStartUpRTD.description: Toggle availability of the automated helicopter start-up and shutdown sequences.

enablePersonTurret.description: Enables or disables firing from a vehicle cargo position. To get the turret path use assignedVehicleRole or getCargoIndex command.

enableRopeAttach.description: Enables or disables the ability to be attached to a rope end for the given entity.

enableStressDamage.description: Toggles stress damage in Advanced Flight Model, which otherwise could be manually toggles in game setting: Options - Game - Helicopter Flight Model - Advanced - Stress Damage.

enginesIsOnRTD.description: Returns which engines are producing some work.

enginesPowerRTD.description: Returns power produced by engines in Watts.

enginesTorqueRTD.description: Torque produced by engines in N·m (Newton*meter).

fullCrew.description: Returns array with all crew inside given vehicle. Since Arma 3 v1.55.133810 it is possible to return empty seats as well.

getSlingLoad.description: Return object which is sling loaded by vehicle

isObjectRTD.description: Returns true if RTD model is loaded.

isStressDamageEnabled.description: Returns true if stress damage is enabled in the game settings. A getter for enableStressDamage.

magazineTurretAmmo.description: Returns ammo count of given type from given turret

numberOfEnginesRTD.description: Returns the number of engines a helicopter has.

ropeAttachedObjects.description: Returns an array of all entities that are attached to the transport with ropes. This command is the opposite of ropeAttachedTo.

ropeAttachedTo.description: Returns the ropes owner, the transport to which other entities are attached with ropes. This command is the opposite of ropeAttachedObjects.

ropeAttachEnabled.description: Returns true if entity can be attached to a rope end.

ropeAttachTo.description: Attaches entity to the rope end with optional offset. For detach operation use ropeDetach.

ropeCreate.description: Creates a PhysX rope with given params. For Take on Helicopters syntax see ropeCreate_TKOH.
ropeCreate.docSyntax: ropeCreate [fromObject, fromPoint, toObject, toPoint, length, ropeStart, ropeEnd]

ropeCut.description: Cuts the given rope to the specified length. If some entity was attached to the end of the rope, it will be detached. The rope remains attached to its parent transport and if the length is set to 0 or even negative does not get destroyed. Use ropeDestroy to remove it completely.

ropeDestroy.description: Destroys the given rope. If the rope is attached to a vehicle, it will be detached and then destroyed.

ropeDetach.description: Detaches attached object from rope (i.e. detaches rope end from attached to it entity). See ropeAttachTo for attach operation.

ropeEndPosition.description: Returns start and end positions for the given rope. If command fails, empty array [] is returned.

ropeLength.description: Return rope length in meters (set by ropeCreate, ropeCut, ropeUnwind).

ropes.description: Returns all ropes attached to a ropes owner transport in an Array, otherwise an empty array [] is returned.

ropeUnwind.description: Increases or decreases the rope length by the given amount. Use relative parameter for changing rope length +/- from current length.
ropeUnwind.example: ropeUnwind [ropes heli1 select 0, 3, 10]; // set rope length to 10m at 3m/s

ropeUnwound.description: Returns false if rope length changing animation is in progress. Returns true if animation is done.
ropeUnwound.example: waitUntil { ropeUnwound (ropes heli1 select 0) }; hint "Unwinding Complete";

serverCommandExecutable.description: Returns true if the serverCommand can be performed on the machine and in this exact environment, otherwise false. serverCommand can be executed only from User Interface Event Handlers, and this command also checks if that's the case.

setActualCollectiveRTD.description: Sets the collective pitch control to a specific position, regardless of input devices (until those are changed).

setCustomWeightRTD.description: Add virtual custom weight to a helicopter's center of gravity. This can be used to simulate added internal payload for specific scenarios, and affects the flight model.

setEngineRPMRTD.description: Instantly set a helicopter's engine RPMs to the given value.

setMagazineTurretAmmo.description: Sets ammo count to given amount for given turret.

setRotorBrakeRTD.description: Toggle a helicopter's rotor brake on or off.

setSlingLoad.description: Creates a sling loading from a helicopter to an entity if possible. To unload cargo, pass objNull as second param.

setWantedRPMRTD.description: Tell the helicopter engine RPMs to reach the given value within a period of time. The simulation will try to reach the RPMs, but it does not guarantee it will reach the precise value!

slingLoadAssistantShown.description: Returns true if Sling Load Assistant is open.
slingLoadAssistantShown.example: waitUntil { slingLoadAssistantShown }; hint "You lack rudimentary motor skills and basic eye-hand coordination."; // scold user for unethical practices

weightRTD.description: For this command to have any effect, the Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model (AFM) has to be enabled. If AFM is enabled can be checked with difficultyEnabledRTD.

wingsForcesRTD.description: For this command to have any effect, the Arma 3 Advanced Helicopter Flight Model (AFM) has to be enabled. If AFM is enabled can be checked with difficultyEnabledRTD.

BIS_fnc_configExtremes.description: Scan config paths and return min and max values for each property.

BIS_fnc_openFieldManual.description: Opens Field Manual in briefing (SP, MP Server, MP Client) and players's map or journal. Selects the topic and hint passed as parameters. Can apply a (search) filter if desired.

configProperties.description: Returns an array of config entries which meet criteria in condition code. Command iterates through available classes and config properties for given config entry. If 3rd param is true the search also includes inherited properties. Current looked at config is stored in _x variable (similar to alternative count command implementation). Condition has to return true in order for the looked at property to be added to the resulting array. A bit slower than configClasses but allows to access inherited entires.

getObjectDLC.description: Returns appID of the DLC the object belongs to or nil if object is vanilla.
getObjectDLC.example: _appID = getObjectDLC cursorTarget; if (!isNil "_appID") then { hint format ["This object belongs to DLC with id: %1", _appID]; } else { hint "This object is vanilla"; };

getPersonUsedDLCs.description: Returns a list of all DLCs objects the unit is currently using. For example if a unit is inside a vehicle from DLC, it will return the code of that DLC.

setUnloadInCombat.description: If cargo or turret units should get out of vehicle when in combat. If true, vehicle will stop and units will dismount. Vehicle must be local.

shownChat.description: Returns true if chat window is enabled. Chat window can be disabled with showChat command.

addWeaponItem.description: Adds a weapon item to the specified weapon. The item can be weapon magazine, in which case the amount of ammo and target muzzle could also be specified.

allControls.description: Returns a list of all controls for desired existing display. Returned controls also include controls from control groups

allDisplays.description: Returns a list of all opened GUI displays. Other displays, such as IGUI displays could be accessed via uiNamespace variable, which is updated every time display is opened or closed. For example, to access IGUI displays: uiNamespace getVariable ["IGUI_displays", []];. Other display variables:

allVariables.description: Returns a list of all variables from desired namespace. Namespaces supported:

configSourceMod.description: Returns modDir of the mod that given config class was loaded from.

getObjectMaterials.description: Gets all custom materials associated with the object.

getObjectTextures.description: Gets all custom textures (hiddenSelectionsTextures) associated with the object.

removeSecondaryWeaponItem.description: Removes given weapon item from the secondary weapon cargo space. This command also supports weapon magazines.

turretOwner.description: Returns id of the owner of the turret. Server only. Returns 0 on non-server and SP.

append.description: Appends array2 to the back of array1 modifying array1.

configSourceModList.description: Returns an array of mods (CfgMods) in which the given config class is defined.

enableUAVWaypoints.description: Enables/disables the option for player to set waypoints for UAV in AV terminal.
enableUAVWaypoints.example: _uav enableUAVWaypoints false; hint str waypointsEnabledUAV _uav; // returns false

groupOwner.description: Returns ID of client to which the group is local. Can be run only from server. When called from client, it always returns 0

setGroupOwner.description: Changes the ownership of a group (and all its units) to a given client. Group leader can't be a player. Only works when called from a server. Returns true if locality was changed. For agents use setOwner command.

waypointsEnabledUAV.description: Checks if the UAV has waypoints enabled.
waypointsEnabledUAV.example: _uav enableUAVWaypoints false; hint str waypointsEnabledUAV _uav; // returns false

BIS_fnc_DataTerminalColor.description: Set Data Terminal colors for its different steps. Steps are:

BIS_fnc_dynamicGroups.description: Function that adds dynamic groups to the mission as seen in End Game. Function needs to be initialized on server and client. Clients can then use action TeamSwitch ("U" by default) to access the Dynamic Groups interface.

BIS_fnc_initVehicle.description: This function changes the textures, animation sources and/or mass of a given vehicle.

BIS_fnc_reenableRevive.description: Enable revive on given unit. Revive system needs to be initialized and running.

BIS_fnc_reviveAllowed.description: Returns true if unit is in general able to revive someone.

BIS_fnc_reviveBleedOut.description: Make a unit bleed out over time while incapacitated.

BIS_fnc_reviveDamageReset.description: Resets player's damage data and recieved damage.

BIS_fnc_reviveEhDammaged.description: /* unit: Object - Object the event handler is assigned to hitSelection: String - Name of the selection where the unit was damaged damage: Number - Resulting level of damage hitPartIndex: Number - hit index of the hit selection hitPoint: String - hit point Cfg name shooter: Object - shooter reference (to get instigator use getShotParents on projectile) projectile: Object - the projectile that caused damage */

BIS_fnc_reviveEhHandleDamage.description: Should be excuted by HandleDamage event handler. See example. Handles damage calculation.

BIS_fnc_reviveEhHandleHeal.description: Handles healing of unit. Unit gets fully healed after 10 seconds if current damage is smaller than initial damage, e.g. a medic healed the unit.

BIS_fnc_reviveEhKilled.description: Should be called from Killed event handler. Handles what happens if unit dies if revive system is enabled.

BIS_fnc_reviveEhRespawn.description: Sets unit's state to respawned. Should probably only be called on respawn event.

BIS_fnc_reviveEnabled.description: Returns is revive is enabled or not for the unit.

BIS_fnc_reviveGet3dIcons.description: Returns structured text that can be displayed in 'Hold Action' tech as animated unconscious state icon.

BIS_fnc_reviveGetActionIcon.description: Returns structured text that can be displayed in 'Hold Action' tech as animated unconscious state icon.

BIS_fnc_reviveIconControl.description: Manage the adding, removing, and effects applied to 3D icons used for visualizing incapacitated units.

BIS_fnc_reviveInit.description: Initialize the Revive system on all machines.

BIS_fnc_reviveIsValid.description: Check if player can perform revive action on given unit.

BIS_fnc_reviveIsValidSecure.description: Check if player can perform secure action on given unit.

BIS_fnc_reviveOnBeingRevived.description: Used to execute specific code locally on every client whenever "being revived" flag changes.

BIS_fnc_reviveOnForcingRespawn.description: /* Author: Jiri Wainar Description: Used to execute specific code localy on every client whenever 'forcing respawn' flag changes. Parameters: _this select 0: STRING - Variable that carries the 'being revived' flag over the network, defined by macro VAR_TRANSFER_FORCING_RESPAWN. _this select 1: BOOL - Flag state - true or false. _this select 2: OBJECT - Unit to set the flag for. Returns: True if successful, false if not. */

BIS_fnc_reviveOnState.description: /* Author: Jiri Wainar Description: Used to execute specific code localy on every client whenever unit's state changes. Parameters: _this select 0: STRING - Variable that carries the state value over the network, defined by macro VAR_TRANSFER_STATE. _this select 1: SCALAR - State. _this select 2: OBJECT - Unit to set the status for. Returns: True if successful, false if not. States: #define STATE_RESPAWNED 0 #define STATE_REVIVED 1 #define STATE_INCAPACITATED 2 #define STATE_DEAD 3 */

BIS_fnc_reviveOnStateJIP.description: /* Author: Jiri Wainar Description: Used to execute state specific code localy on client that is JIPping. Parameters: _this select 0: STRING - Variable that carries the state value over the network, defined by macro VAR_TRANSFER_STATE. _this select 1: SCALAR - State. _this select 2: OBJECT - Unit to set the status for. Returns: True if successful, false if not. States: #define STATE_RESPAWNED 0 #define STATE_REVIVED 1 #define STATE_INCAPACITATED 2 #define STATE_DEAD 3 */

BIS_fnc_reviveSecureUnit.description: Make player secured (killed without execution penalties) by _source unit.

channelEnabled.description: Returns true or false depending on whether the given channel is enabled or disabled. For more information about enabling/disabling of chat channels see enableChannel.
channelEnabled.example: _isGlobalChatEnabled = (channelEnabled 0) select 0; // check if user can use text on global channel

controlsGroupCtrl.description: Returns a child control with specified idc from a controls group

currentChannel.description: Returns currently selected user chat channel on the UI (selected with < and > in MP). Correspondence between channel and number:
currentChannel.example: _selected = currentChannel; // 3 - for example for the Group

enableChannel.description: Enables/disables UI functionality which is responsible for sending text or voice chat to the given chat channel. If the channel was disabled in description.ext, it can be enabled with this command, however the UI functionality changes will be local to the PC executing this command. What this command cannot do:
enableChannel.example: 0 enableChannel false; // Disable user ability to send voice and text on global channel

getPlayerChannel.description: Returns channel number for given player, provided that player is speaking, otherwise -1. Having mic on is not enough, player has to make a sound. There are several limitations to this command:

getSuppression.description: Gets the suppression value for the given unit. Returns varying Number between 0 and 1, or -1 if suppression is disabled (disableAI "SUPPRESSION") or the suppression value is not available. Suppression is not calculated for player entities and is always 0, unless it is set with setSuppression. In this case the return value is the set value. Before Arma 3 v1.91.145360 this command could return nil.

isTurnedOut.description: Returns true if given unit is turned out, otherwise false. The output changes to true after unit finished turning out, however will change to false almost immediately after unit is ordered to turn in.

isWeaponDeployed.description: Returns true if weapon is currently deployed.

isWeaponRested.description: Returns true if weapon is currently rested.

leaderboardRequestRowsFriends.description: Requests given leaderboard to download friends rows from the given leaderboard

leaderboardsRequestUploadScore.description: Starts async. operation to upload score to board with given name, value always overwrite the current value in the board. The details array is optional. The board has to be initialized before the call.

leaderboardsRequestUploadScoreKeepBest.description: Starts async. operation to upload score to board with given name, value is only stored to board if it's better than one already in the board. The details array is optional. The board has to be initialized before the call.

leaderboardState.description: returns state of the board with given name. 0: Busy (async. operation in progress); 1: Async. operation ended with success; 2: Async. operation ended with error; 3: Invalid board (bad board name, not initialized etc.).

setCurrentChannel.description: Sets given channel as current chat channel. Scripted way of selecting desired channel on the UI. The given channel may be disabled (see enableChannel), this is why this command returns boolean, true on success or false on failure. Correspondence between channel and number:
setCurrentChannel.example: _isDirectSelected = setCurrentChannel 5; // sets Direct channel as current active

setSuppression.description: Sets the given suppression value for the given unit. The value range is from 0 to 1.

diag_activeMissionFSMs.description: Returns array with active Mission FSMs. To see number of all scripts currently in the scheduler use diag_activeScripts.

diag_activeSQFScripts.description: Returns information about active SQF scripts. To see number of all scripts currently in the scheduler use diag_activeScripts.
diag_activeSQFScripts.example: [] spawn { hint str diag_activeSQFScripts; }; // displays [["<spawn> hint str diag_activeSQFScripts;", "", true, 1]]

diag_activeSQSScripts.description: Returns array with active SQSs. To see number of all scripts currently in the scheduler use diag_activeScripts.

sort.description: Attempts to sort given array either in ascending (true) or descending (false) order. All array elements should be one of the following types:

lbSetSelectColor.description: Sets the select color of the item with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to color.

lbSetSelectColorRight.description: Sets the select color of the of the secondary text (right aligned) of the item with the given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to color.

profileNameSteam.description: Returns name of the current Steam profile. For currently chosen user profile name see profileName

allPlayers.description: Returns a list of all human players including dead players. The command also returns all connected headless clients. To filter headless clients out: _justPlayers = allPlayers - entities "HeadlessClient_F"; NOTES:
allPlayers.example: { systemChat format [ "Player %1 is %2", name _x, ["dead", "alive"] select alive _x ]; } forEach allPlayers;

arrayIntersect.description: Intersects array1 with array2 returning array of unique common elements. Additionally, using the same array for array1 and array2 will simply return array of unique elements. Intersects only 1st dimension of an array.

BIS_fnc_unitHeadgear.description: Randomise headgear and facewear of a character.
BIS_fnc_unitHeadgear.example: [this] call BIS_fnc_unitHeadgear; // headgear and face wear, same as [this, [], []]

configHierarchy.description: Returns hierarchy of the given config class. Just like with inheritsFrom, only complete config classes are supported

currentNamespace.description: Returns current global namespace the script runs in.
currentNamespace.example: if (currentNamespace isEqualTo uiNamespace) then {hint "This is uiNamespace"};

currentThrowable.description: Returns currently selected throwable, which will be launched if the user presses "G".

getObjectViewDistance.description: Gets the values of rendering distances of objects and shadows.

isObjectHidden.description: Checks visibility of a given object on the local machine.

param.description: Extracts a single value with given index from input argument, similar to BIS_fnc_param. When used without argument, as shown in main syntax, internal variable _this, which is usually available inside functions and event handlers, is used as argument. If input argument is not an array, it will be converted to 1 element array.
param.example: [1, 2, 3] call { private _one = param [0, 1]; private _two = param [1, 2]; private _three = param [2, 3]; // ... };

params.description: Parses input argument into array of private variables. When used without argument, as shown in main syntax, internal variable _this, which is usually available inside functions and event handlers, is used as argument.
params.example: [1, 2, 3] call { private ["_one", "_two", "_three"]; _one = _this select 0; _two = _this select 1; _three = _this select 2; // ... }; // Same as above, only using params [1, 2, 3] call { params ["_one", "_two", "_three"]; // ... };

roleDescription.description: Returns unit description set in Editor and visible on role selection screen in MP. Works in MP and SP.

serverName.description: Returns name of the hosting server in MP, "" in SP.

weaponInertia.description: Returns current rate of how much the weapon view is distorted because of quick aiming

worldSize.description: Returns the engine calculated size of the current world (do not confuse with BIS_fnc_mapSize, which could return the same value, but is just a simple look up in config).

AGLToASL.description: Converts position from PositionAGL to PositionASL

ASLToAGL.description: Converts position from PositionASL to PositionAGL

didJIP.description: Checks if the current client Joined In Progress.

didJIPOwner.description: Checks if the current owner of supplied Object Joined In Progress. Server execution only. On clients returns false.

distance2D.description: Returns a 2D distance (distance projected to X,Y plane) in meters between two Objects or two Positions or Object and Position.

getAllHitPointsDamage.description: Returns 3 arrays for easy cross reference: 1st - array of hit point names, 2nd - array of hit selection names, 3rd - array of damage values. All values in all arrays are ordered accordingly to hit part index for convenience and for use in setHitIndex and getHitIndex. Levels of damage are:

getHitIndex.description: Return current level of damage for a specific Hit Point (specified by its hit part index). All hit points can be obtained with getAllHitPointsDamage command.

getModelInfo.description: Returns object's model info in format [modelName, modelPath, hasSkeleton]. Model path is suitable for use with createSimpleObject command.

getObjectType.description: Returns object type as a number:

joinString.description: Joins array into String with provided separator. Array can be of mixed types, all elements will be converted to String prior to joining, but the fastest operation is on the array of Strings.
joinString.example: _str = "- This, is a sample string." splitString "-,. "; // ["This","is","a","sample","string"] _str joinString " "; // "This is a sample string"

lineIntersectsSurfaces.description: Returns list of intersections with surfaces from begPosASL to endPosASL. If there is ground intersection, it is also included. Works on units. Works underwater. Doesn't return intersection with sea surface. Hardcoded max distance: 5000m. By default, for speed purposes, command will return only 1st intersection with unique objects. Since Arma 3 v1.69.140138, this could be tweaked with an optional param.
lineIntersectsSurfaces.example: _intersections = lineIntersectsSurfaces [eyePos player, aimPos chopper, player, chopper, true, -1];
lineIntersectsSurfaces.docSyntax: lineIntersectsSurfaces [begPosASL, endPosASL, ignoreObj1, ignoreObj2, sortMode, maxResults, LOD1, LOD2, returnUnique]

objectParent.description: Returns parent of an object if the object is proxy, otherwise objNull. In case of backpack, the parent is a weaponholder or a cargo space of a vehicle or the unit carrying it. Unit in a vehicle will return the vehicle as parent.

remoteExec.description: Remote async execution of given funtion on given machines. Function can contain delaying commands (i.e. sleep).

remoteExecCall.description: Remote async execution of given funtion on given machines. Function can not contain delaying commands (i.e. sleep).

setHitIndex.description: Set the current level of damage for a specific Hit Point (specified by its hit part index). All hit points can be obtained with getAllHitPointsDamage command.

splitString.description: An SQF version of C++ strtok. Splits given string str into an array of tokens according to given delimiters. In addition, if empty string "" is used for delimiters, str is split by each character.
splitString.example: _str = "- This, is a sample string." splitString "-,. "; // ["This","is","a","sample","string"] _str joinString " "; // "This is a sample string"

targetKnowledge.description: Returns unit's knowledge about target. The returned array includes information whether the target is

ctrlAngle.description: Gets rotation info of an ST_PICTURE control.

disableNVGEquipment.description: Enables or disables transport NV (Night Vision). To disable TI (Thermal Imaging) use disableTIEquipment.

disableRemoteSensors.description: This command will halt raycasting calculations (on the local machine only) for all groups which don't contain any local entities. Units, that are not in a group with at least one local member, will not check visibility of other units. This will cause, that remote units will not have updated knowsAbout and it will save some CPU time. If a group contains a single local entity then calculations will still be performed for the entire group.

getRemoteSensorsDisabled.description: Get status of disabled raycasts for remote entities. See disableRemoteSensors for detailed description.

magazinesAllTurrets.description: Returns all magazines (including empty) from all vehicle turrets (including driver turret [-1]) and their ammo counts.

shownHUD.description: Returns array of Booleans corresponding to the visibility of various HUD elements (see extended showHUD).

allowSprint.description: Force player to run/jog if set to false.

BIS_fnc_EGObjectiveVisualizer.description: Part of the EG Spectator Mode.

BIS_fnc_EGObjectiveVisualizerDraw.description: Part of the EG Spectator Mode.

BIS_fnc_EGSpectatorCamera.description: Part of the EG Spectator Mode.

flagSide.description: Returns Side of the local instance of the flag. A getter for setFlagSide.

flagTexture.description: Returns texture of the local instance of the flag. A getter for setFlagTexture. It will not return flag textures applied using forceFlagTexture, use getForcedFlagTexture for that.

getAnimAimPrecision.description: Returns aim precision for current animation

getCustomAimCoef.description: Returns aimPrecision from animation state with custom value that will directly affects weapon sway size and speed.

getMousePosition.description: Returns mouse position in UI coordinates.

getStamina.description: Get current stamina (~ seconds until depletion)

inPolygon.description: Checks whether position is inside given polygon

isAimPrecisionEnabled.description: Returns true if procedural aiming precision affects weapon sway.

isEqualType.description: Compares 2 values by their type. A much faster alternative to typeName a == typeName b.

isEqualTypeAll.description: Compares types of all elements of an array to the type of a single value.

isEqualTypeAny.description: Compares type of given value to every type in the given array and if match is found, true is returned.

isEqualTypeArray.description: Compares types of all elements of one array to types of all elements of another array.

isEqualTypeParams.description: Compares types of all elements of input array to types of all elements of template array. Similar to isEqualTypeArray however this command is designed for fast validation of functions params, so there are differences:
isEqualTypeParams.example: [1,2,player,"10"] isEqualTypeParams [0,0,objNull,""]; //true 123 isEqualTypeParams [0,0,objNull,""]; //false [] isEqualTypeParams [0,0,objNull,""]; //false [1,2,player] isEqualTypeParams [0,0,objNull,""]; //false [1,2,player,"10",true] isEqualTypeParams [0,0,nil,""]; //true [1,2,getPos player,"10",true] isEqualTypeParams [0,0,nil,""]; //true

isSprintAllowed.description: Returns true if player is allowed to sprint

isStaminaEnabled.description: Check if stamina depletion is enabled

nearestTerrainObjects.description: Returns a list of nearest terrain objects of the given types to the given position or object, within the specified distance. If more than one object is found they will be ordered according to 3D distance to the object (i.e. the closest one will be first in the array). In contrast to nearestObjects this command returns terrain placed objects like trees, rocks and buildings which don't necessarily need an associated config class.

setAnimSpeedCoef.description: Sets a coefficient for animation speed (0.5 will play animations half the speed, 2 twice the speed).

setCustomAimCoef.description: Set custom aim precision coefficient for weapon sway

setObjectMaterialGlobal.description: Set the material of the given selection on all computers in a network session.

setStaminaScheme.description: Set stamina bar color. The scheme can be "Normal", "FastDrain", "Exhausted" or "Default".

add3DENConnection.example: add3DENConnection ["RandomStart",get3DENSelected "Object","marker_0"] Set random start on marker "marker_0" for all selected objects.

add3DENEventHandler.description: Add code to be run when a Eden Editor event is triggered.

add3DENLayer.description: Add an editing layer in Eden Editor.

BIS_fnc_sideIsEnemy.description: Determines if side B is enemy to side A the way the game engine does it. The relationship table can be found here: Side relations.
BIS_fnc_sideIsEnemy.example: _isEnemy = [west, east] call BIS_fnc_sideIsEnemy; //Checks if EAST is enemy to WEST.

BIS_fnc_sideIsFriendly.description: Determines if side B is friendly to side A the way the game engine does it. The relationship table can be found here: Side relations.
BIS_fnc_sideIsFriendly.example: _isFriendly = [west, east] call BIS_fnc_sideIsFriendly; //Checks if EAST is friendly to WEST.

checkVisibility.description: Checks if one position is visible from another position and how much. The results can be affected by getTerrainGrid value, especially if position is near the ground. Particle effects such as smoke can also affect the results.

clear3DENAttribute.description: Clears the value of the given entity's attribute in Eden Editor.

clear3DENInventory.description: Deletes inventory from mission.sqm of given units. Effect is not immediately visible, only when previewing the inventory resets to default.

collect3DENHistory.description: Execute a block of code in which all Eden Editor operations will be recorded as one history step. For example creating an entity, setting its attributes and then connections would normally be recorded as three different steps. Calling them all within single collect3DENHistory block will group them together and the user will need to undo only once to revert the changes.
collect3DENHistory.example: collect3DENHistory { _logic = create3DENEntity ["Logic", "Logic", position player]; add3DENConnection ["Sync", [_logic], player ]; }; Creates a logic and connects it to player in one history step.

create3DENComposition.description: Create new Composition. To create individual entities, use create3DENEntity.

create3DENEntity.description: Create new Eden Entity. Used for creating individual entities; to create a composition (e.g., infantry squad), use create3DENComposition.

current3DENOperation.description: Returns the currently performed editing operation in Eden Editor.

cursorObject.description: Returns the object under cursor. This command is quite different from cursorTarget as it is more precise in determining the boundaries of the pointed at object and can detect a larger variety of objects including map objects and trees.

delete3DENEntities.description: Delete given entities in Eden Editor, including anything that can be placed in editor.

edit3DENMissionAttributes.description: Open a window with scenario attribute in given section.

exportJIPMessages.description: Export list of JIP to a file.

get3DENActionState.description: Returns state of given action in the Eden Editor.

get3DENAttribute.description: Returns the value of the given entity's attribute in Eden Editor.
get3DENAttribute.example: systemChat str ((get3DENMouseOver select 1) get3DENAttribute "name"); // returns variable name of object under cursor

get3DENCamera.description: Returns the camera Object used by the Eden Editor.
get3DENCamera.example: // set exact yaw, pitch, and roll _y = 45; _p = -80; _r = 0; get3DENCamera setVectorDirAndUp [ [ sin _y * cos _p,cos _y * cos _p,sin _p], [ [ sin _r,-sin _p,cos _r * cos _p],-_y] call BIS_fnc_rotateVector2D ];

get3DENConnections.description: Return all connections currently present on an entity.

get3DENEntity.description: Returns Eden Entity based on its Eden ID. If the ID points to a layer or a comment, the ID will be returned instead.

get3DENEntityID.description: Returns unique index of an Eden Entity. This number remains the same even after saving and loading the scenario.

get3DENGrid.description: Returns the grid increment for the given transformation type.

get3DENIconsVisible.description: Get visibility state of Eden Editor icons.
get3DENIconsVisible.example: if (get3DENIconsVisible select 0) then {hint "Icons are visible in the map.";};

get3DENLayerEntities.description: Return all entities and sub-layer in Eden Entity layer.

get3DENLinesVisible.description: Get visibility state of Eden Editor lines.
get3DENLinesVisible.example: if (get3DENLinesVisible select 0) then {hint "Lines are visible in the map.";};

get3DENMouseOver.description: Returns the Eden Entity the mouse is hovering over in Eden Editor.

get3DENSelected.description: Returns an array of all selected Eden Editor Entities of the given type, or, if empty string "" is used, an array of 6 arrays in the following format:
get3DENSelected.example: systemChat str (get3DENSelected ""); /* outputs: [ [B Alpha 2-1:1],//objects [B Alpha 2-1],//groups [164494: <no shape>],//triggers [<No center> Charlie 1-2:4],//logic [ [B Alpha 2-1,0] ],//waypoints ["Hotel_Whiskey"]//markers ]*/

getClientStateNumber.description: Returns client state in network game. Works on both, client and dedicated server. The following states are possible:

getMissionConfig.description: Returns Config entry for the given scenario attribute from the 1st tier. The attribute can be config class or config property. If it is defined in multiple places, the command checks them in the following order:
getMissionConfig.example: _header = getMissionConfig "Header" Returns scenario header config. Replaces the previous approach which would scan only the external Description.ext file, but ignore the value set in the Eden Editor: _header = missionConfigFile >> "Header"; // Old approach

getMissionConfigValue.description: Returns value of the given scenario attribute from the 1st tier. Since only config properties have values, the attribute should be config property. If it is not found or config class is given, the return is nil. If the attribute defined in multiple places, the command checks them in the following order:
getMissionConfigValue.example: _respawnDelay = getMissionConfigValue ["respawnDelay",0] Returns respawn delay value. Replaces the previous approach which would scan only the external Description.ext file, but ignore the value set in the Eden Editor: _respawnDelay = getNumber (missionConfigFile >> "respawnDelay"); // Old approach

getMissionLayerEntities.description: Returns all entities within specific Eden Editor layer. To be used when the scenario is running, not in the editor workspace. Useful for disabling / enabling whole parts of the scenario which you add to specific layer while editing.

getPlayerScores.description: In MP: returns the unit's table of scores (infantry kills, soft vehicle kills, armor kills, air kills, deaths, total score). In SP: empty array []

getRelDir.description: Returns direction, which is relative to object's current direction, from given object to another object or position in the range from 0 to 360, the equivalent of BIS_fnc_relativeDirTo. Taking the current direction of the object into account.

getRelPos.description: Returns position, which is given distance and relative direction away from original object.
getRelPos.example: Find position 100 metres away at player's 3 o'clock:_relpos = player getRelPos [100, 90];

is3DEN.description: Returns true if the Eden Editor is currently being used. true when inside editor environment, false during preview. (see also is3DENMultiplayer)
is3DEN.example: if is3DEN then {systemChat "Welcome to Eden Editor!"};

is3DENMultiplayer.description: Returns true if the Eden Editor is in multiplayer mode. Returns true in the following cases:
is3DENMultiplayer.example: if is3DENMultiplayer then {systemChat "Your hosting a test server!"};

isFilePatchingEnabled.description: Returns true if file patching is enabled otherwise false

leaderboardDeInit.description: Deletes internal class for the leaderboard with given name. Returns true if the board has been found and deinitialized.

leaderboardGetRows.description: Returns an array with values for the given leaderboard, the array is in format: [[player1Name, score, rank], [player2Name, score, rank], [player3Name, score, rank] ... ]; This can be called after the one of the row request function has been called and successfully finished!

leaderboardInit.description: Initialize the leaderboard structure for board with given name. Returns true if board is already initialized.

lockIdentity.description: Locks the identity of a person. This will disable default identity.

logNetwork.description: Registers new log file recording a network traffic and returns handle of the log. The log file is saved inside the Arma 3 root folder.

logNetworkTerminate.description: Terminates a network log file started with logNetwork with the given handle

menuAction.description: Returns action stored in item on given path in CT_MENU_STRIP control.

menuAdd.description: Adds new submenu entry into item on given path.

menuChecked.description: Returns if item on given path is checked or not.

menuClear.description: Removes all entries from given menu strip.

menuCollapse.description: Collapses item on given path and all its childs.

menuData.description: Returns data stored in menu entry on given path.

menuDelete.description: Deletes menu entry on given path.

menuEnable.description: Enables disabled menu entry on given path.

menuEnabled.description: Returns if menu entry on given path is enabled or not.

menuExpand.description: Expands given menu entry on given path and all its parents so entry is visible.

menuHover.description: Returns path to menu entry mouse is currently hovering over.

menuPicture.description: Returns picture set into item on given path

menuSetAction.description: Sets new action into menu entry on given path.

menuSetCheck.description: Sets item on given path to be checked or not.

menuSetData.description: Sets new data into item on given path.

menuSetPicture.description: Sets new picture into menu entry on given path.

menuSetValue.description: Sets new value into menu entry on given path.

menuShortcut.description: Returns shortcut related to menu entry on given path.

menuShortcutText.description: Returns a string containing shortcut text for menu item on the given path.

menuSize.description: Returns how many sub entries is in item on given path.

menuSort.description: Sorts subentries of item on given path by their text.

menuText.description: Returns current text set in menu entry on given path.

menuURL.description: Returns current URL set in entry on given path.

menuValue.description: Returns current value set in menu entry on given path.

missionVersion.description: Returns the version of the current mission.

move3DENCamera.description: Moves Eden Editor camera to given position, with or without offset.

ppEffectEnabled.description: Checks whether given post process effect is enabled

pushBackUnique.description: Adds element to the back of the given array but only if it is unique to the array. The index of the added element is returned upon success, otherwise -1. This command modifies the original array.

remove3DENConnection.example: remove3DENConnection ["RandomStart",get3DENSelected "Object","marker_0"] Remove random start on marker "marker_0" from all selected objects.

remove3DENEventHandler.description: Removes Eden Editor event handler of given type and ID.

removeAll3DENEventHandlers.description: Removes all Eden Editor event handlers of given type.

save3DENInventory.description: Saves current state of entitie's inventory to SQM.

selectRandom.description: Returns a random element from the given array. Engine solution to BIS_fnc_selectRandom

set3DENAttribute.example: player set3DENAttribute ["allowDamage",false ]; Mark player as invincible

set3DENAttributes.example: set3DENAttributes [[get3DENSelected "Object","ControlMP",true ]]; Set all selected objects as playable

set3DENGrid.description: Sets the grid increment for the given transformation type.

set3DENIconsVisible.description: Toggle visibility of Eden Editor icons.
set3DENIconsVisible.example: set3DENIconsVisible [ false, false ]; Hide all icons

set3DENLinesVisible.description: Toggle visibility of Eden Editor lines.
set3DENLinesVisible.example: set3DENLinesVisible [ false, false ]; Hide all lines

set3DENMissionAttributes.example: set3DENMissionAttributes [["Multiplayer","respawn",3],["Multiplayer","respawnDelay",10]]; Set respawn type to 3 and respawn delay to 10 seconds

set3DENModelsVisible.description: Enables or disables lines visibility in 3DEN

set3DENObjectType.description: Sets the classname of one or more given Eden Editor objects. For Logic objects use set3DENLogicType
set3DENObjectType.example: [ get3DENMouseOver select 1] set3DENObjectType "B_crew_F"; // turns object under cursor into a blufor crewman

set3DENSelected.description: Changes selection in 3den to what is inside entities array.

tvSetText.description: Sets string text to item on given path. IDC means id of parent Tree View.

allCutLayers.description: Returns all named layers used by cutRsc, cutText, cutObj or cutFadeOut. The layer normally would be added on the first use of any of the aforementioned commands, however if a layer needs to be reserved it could be done like so:

animateSource.description: Process an animation of the object. If animate uses class name from CfgModels Animations, animateSource uses name defined by source property. This allows to use just one command on a bunch of animations related to the same source simultaneously. Since Arma 3 v1.65.138459 speed of animation can be altered with coefficient.

animationNames.description: Returns Array of Strings where elements are the names of model animations, which should theoretically be available for use with animate command. However in practice this depends on whether animation is also made available for use in scripts via config.

animationSourcePhase.description: Returns current animation phase of given source. Similar to animationPhase or doorPhase but designed to complement animateSource. This command could be used to obtain relative turret direction and gun elevation on a vehicle (see Example 2)

BIS_fnc_3DENEntityMenu.description: Excutes actions available in the entity menu (context menu).

BIS_fnc_3DENGrid.description: Handles action when grid button is pressed in the toolbar in Eden Editor.

BIS_fnc_3DENIntel.description: Is used to set the weather settings in Eden Editor. Internal use only.

BIS_fnc_3DENListLocations.description: Used in the locations display in Eden Editor. Internal use only.

BIS_fnc_3DENModuleDescription.description: Used to display module description in the attribute window.

BIS_fnc_3DENNotification.description: Show notification in the Eden Editor
BIS_fnc_3DENNotification.example: ["This is an animated notification", 0] call BIS_fnc_3DENNotification;

BIS_fnc_3DENShowMessage.docSyntax: [text, title, buttonOK, buttonCancel, icon] call BIS_fnc_3DENShowMessage

BIS_fnc_3DENToolbar.description: Interacts with the Eden Editor toolbar

BIS_fnc_getArea.description: Extracts area information from trigger, marker, location or array

BIS_fnc_groupFromNetId.description: Extends MP-only groupFromNetId functionality to SP

BIS_fnc_initSliderValue.description: Iniitialises a slider attribute control within the Eden Editor.
BIS_fnc_initSliderValue.docSyntax: [Slider, Edit box, Measurement unit, Default value] call BIS_fnc_initSliderValue;

BIS_fnc_netId.description: Extends MP-only netId functionality to SP

BIS_fnc_objectFromNetId.description: Extends MP-only objectFromNetId functionality to SP

BIS_fnc_sunriseSunsetTime.example: // get sunrise/sunset time for the current date sunriseSunsetTime = date call BIS_fnc_sunriseSunsetTime;

BIS_fnc_taskSetAlwaysVisible.description: Flags task to be or not to be always visible.

BIS_fnc_taskSetType.description: Sets task type to given task.

BIS_fnc_taskTypeIcon.description: Returns path to the icon texture associated with given task type.

canSuspend.description: Returns true if sleep, uiSleep or waitUntil commands can be used in current scope. Usually when suspension is not allowed but used, for example when code is executed in unscheduled environment, the script engine would ignore any suspension command and throw error: "Suspending not allowed in this context". Using canSuspend command allows to detect the correct environment for the code.
canSuspend.example: onEachFrame { systemChat str canSuspend; //false [] spawn {hint str canSuspend}; //true onEachFrame {}; };

configSourceAddonList.description: Returns an array of addons (CfgPatches) in which the given config class is defined.

createSimpleObject.description: Create object with given shape defined as path to .p3d model. Supported LODs include Geometry, Fire Geometry, Roadway, View Geometry and ShadowVolume. Supported features include collision, texturing, animation, penetration, AI spotting occlusion, and surface specific sounds (like footsteps). Unsupported features include PhysX, damage, AI pathfinding (causes walking through walls), and built in lights.
createSimpleObject.example: _pos = player getRelPos [10, 0]; _tank = createSimpleObject ["a3\armor_f_beta\apc_tracked_01\apc_tracked_01_rcws_f.p3d", _pos]; _tank setPos (_pos vectorAdd (getPosWorld _tank vectorDiff (_tank modelToWorld [0,0,0]))); _tank hideSelection ["zasleh", true]; _tank hideSelection ["zasleh2", true]; _tank hideSelection ["clan", true]; _tank animate ["Wheel_podkoloL3", 0.5, true]; _tank animate ["Wheel_podkoloL6", 0.5, true];

ctrlParentControlsGroup.description: Returns the parent control of a given child control. If the control is not part of a CT_CONTROLS_GROUP control then controlNull is returned.
ctrlParentControlsGroup.example: _ctrlCombo = _ctrl controlsGroupCtrl 100; // control ctrlParentControlsGroup _ctrlCombo; // parent control group (_ctrl)

diag_codePerformance.description: Attempts to run given code with given arguments given number of cycles in unscheduled environment and returns average time it took to run the code as well as actual number of executions performed. The command will return as soon as possible if the tested code is slow and the duration of the command exceeds 1 second. Engine alternative to BIS_fnc_codePerformance

difficultyOption.description: Checks specific difficulty settings of the current user. Difficulty flag names can be found in the CfgDifficultyPresets config class or in ArmA profile file under class DifficultyPresets/xxx/Options (xxx being Recruit, Regular or Veteran).

displayParent.description: Returns parent display of the given display.

drawPolygon.description: Draws given polygon on the given map control with given color. The polygon must consist of at least 3 points. Unlike with other draw<shape> commands and due to complexity, this command does not support filling of the polygon with color. Use drawTriangle command to construct and fill polygon shape as a workaround.
drawPolygon.example: test_polygon = []; for "_i" from 1 to 12 do { test_polygon pushBack (player getPos [10 + random 100, 360/_i]); }; findDisplay 12 displayCtrl 51 ctrlAddEventHandler ["Draw", { _this select 0 drawPolygon [test_polygon, [0,0,1,1]]; }];

getCameraViewDirection.description: Returns the direction unit is looking in render time scope. While for AI the origin for the view direction vector can be taken from eyePos unit, for human player the origin should be taken from player camera position positionCameraToWorld [0,0,0]
getCameraViewDirection.example: Draw AI eye direction (green), weapon direction (red) and camera direction (blue) in 3D: bob = createGroup east createUnit ["O_Soldier_F", [0,0,0], [], 0, "NONE"]; bob setVehiclePosition [player modelToWorld [0,100,0], [], 0, "NONE"]; onEachFrame { _beg = ASLToAGL eyePos bob; _endE = (_beg vectorAdd (eyeDirection bob vectorMultiply 100)); drawLine3D [ _beg, _endE, [0,1,0,1]]; _endW = (_beg vectorAdd (bob weaponDirection currentWeapon bob vectorMultiply 100)); drawLine3D [_beg, _endW, [1,0,0,1]]; _endV = (_beg vectorAdd (getCameraViewDirection bob vectorMultiply 100)); drawLine3D [_beg, _endV, [0,0,1,1]]; };

When String for class name is supplied, the command will search CfgVehicles for the given class in order to extract the loadout from config. getUnitTrait.description: Gets the current value of a trait of the given unit.

hideSelection.description: Hides or enables the given selection for the simple object

inArea.description: Checks whether given position is inside given area. The area is usually a rectangle or an ellipse defined similar to triggerArea format. Hence argument for this command could be a trigger, a marker, a location or an array in format [center, a, b, angle, isRectangle, c]. This command also supports hexagon area which can be created from ellipse when both a and b are negative. Hexagon ellipses are also supported by both marker creation and drawEllipse.

moonPhase.description: Returns the phase of the in-game Moon on the given date in range 0...1, where 0 - new Moon, 1 - full Moon. According to this command the fullest Moon in Arma 3 at midnight is on setDate [4804,7,13,0,0]; Use Moon Phase Utility to find out date for a mission with desired moon.

roadAt.description: Returns road segment at given position, objNull otherwise. Same as isOnRoad only returns the actual road object instead of boolean.

selectionNames.description: Returns the list of model selections

setSimpleTaskAlwaysVisible.description: Makes the given task allways visible or not.

setSimpleTaskCustomData.description: Set custom data for the task. Tooltip will be drawn in task list on the right side. Description will be drawn in task description panel on the bottom.

setSimpleTaskType.description: Attach type to the simple task. See Default Task Types.

setTaskMarkerOffset.description: Sets the task marker position in model space.

setUnitLoadout.description: Creates a loadout from given inventory structure and applies it to a unit. When String for class name is supplied, the command will search CfgVehicles for the given class in order to extract the loadout from config. If Config is given, it will search given config (including mission config) for the loadout information. In either case, the config should contain the following entries, which is standard for any unit class, for example:
setUnitLoadout.example: player_2 setUnitLoadout (getUnitLoadout player_1); // Copies loadout from player_1 and applies it to player_2

setUnitTrait.description: Enables or disables a trait or alters a trait of the given unit. Custom trait can only be a bool.

setWaypointForceBehaviour.description: Forces the behavior of waypoint, disables AUTOCOMBAT.

sideAmbientLife.description: Returns side of ambient life, for example ambient life placed in Eden Editor.

sideEmpty.description: Returns empty side, for example static buildings in Eden Editor.

taskAlwaysVisible.description: Returns true if the task is flagged to be always visible or false if not.

taskCustomData.description: Returns custom data attached to the local task or an empty array if there are no custom data attached.

taskMarkerOffset.description: Returns model space position for the task marker

taskType.description: Returns the type of the given task

waypointForceBehaviour.description: Returns true if the waypoint behavior is forced.

BIS_fnc_addRespawnInventory.description: Add a respawn inventory for respawn menu.

BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews.description: Export screeenshots of objects for Eden Editor and Community Wiki to <Arma 3 Profile>\Screenshots\EditorPreviews directory.
BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews.docSyntax: [duration, type, sides, mods, addons] spawn BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews

BIS_fnc_getRespawnInventories.description: Return respawn inventories available for the given target.

BIS_fnc_removeRespawnInventory.description: Remove a respawn inventory added by BIS_fnc_addRespawnInventory.

BIS_fnc_showRespawnMenuDisableItem.description: Limits respawn loadout or role for Arma 3 Respawn.
BIS_fnc_showRespawnMenuDisableItem.example: ["disable",uiNamespace getVariable "BIS_RscRespawnControlsMap_ctrlRoleList",2,"Restricted for this part of mission!"] call BIS_fnc_showRespawnMenuDisableItem;

commandSuppressiveFire.description: Orders the given unit or a group of units to suppress the given position or target (with radio messages, see doSuppressiveFire if you don't want messages).

doSuppressiveFire.description: Orders the given unit or a group of units to suppress the given position or target (without radio messages, see commandSuppressiveFire is you need messages).

getTerrainGrid.description: A getter for setTerrainGrid, returns the current terrain grid.

pixelGrid.description: Returns grid size based on screen resolution, UI size and configs: uiScaleFactor, uiScaleMaxGrids.

pixelH.description: Returns the height of one pixel for current resolution.

pixelW.description: Returns width of one pixel for current resolution.

screenshot.description: Captures a screenshot and stores it to given filename.

shownScoretable.description: Returns the state of the score table set with showScoretable command.

showScoretable.description: Forces the score table to be shown, hidden or reset to default functionality. Forcing score table will make it show even in SP. When score table is forced opened it cannot be closed manually, when it is force closed, it cannot be opened manually.

useAISteeringComponent.description: Enable the new AI driving, used to test the old and new AI driving.

userInputDisabled.description: Returns true if user input is disabled
userInputDisabled.example: if (!userInputDisabled) then { disableUserInput true; } else { disableUserInput false; };

addOwnedMine.description: Sets ownership over a remotely detonatable mine to the unit.

addPlayerScores.description: MP server only: Adds player score.

BIS_fnc_adjustSimpleObject.description: Adjust simple object vertical position, animations and selection according to provided data.
BIS_fnc_adjustSimpleObject.docSyntax: [object, [class, model, reversed, verticalOffset, animAdjustments, selectionToHide]] call BIS_fnc_adjustSimpleObject

BIS_fnc_createSimpleObject.description: Creates non-simulated framerate and network performance friendly object - a simple object - and applies different adjustments to fake non-existing physX and engine interactions. The adjustments need either to be stored in the object config or provided as the function input, otherwise they need to be done manually.
BIS_fnc_createSimpleObject.example: ["B_Boat_Armed_01_minigun_F", getPosWorld player, getDir player] call BIS_fnc_createSimpleObject;
BIS_fnc_createSimpleObject.docSyntax: [input, position, direction, followTerrain, forceSuperSimpleObject] call BIS_fnc_createSimpleObject

BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_dynamicAISkill.description: Changes AI skill based on player count, responding to player connected / player disconnected events. This function does exactly the same as BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_setSkill execept that it automatically executes when a player joins or disconnects.

BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_getCinematicMode.description: Returns whether or not player is in cinematic mode.

BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_getPlayersGroup.description: Returns group that players belong to in coop campaign scenario.

BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_guidedProjectile.description: /* Author: Nelson Duarte Description: Spawns object of given class and makes it travel, hooming towards the target To be used with CfgAmmo type of entity, but can be used with virtually any kind of object Parameters: _startPos: ARRAY The initial position of the projectile (ASL) _class: STRING or OBJECT The class name of the object to spawn or an object entity already existing _target: OBJECT The target object the projectile will be hooming towards to _speed: SCALAR The speed the object should assume _destroyTarget: BOOL Whether to force destruction of the target object on detonation _localOffset: ARRAY The model space position offset that projectile should be hooming towards to _minDistanceToTarget: SCALAR The minimal distance projectile needs to be from target position to enter ballistic mode _function STRING The function to execute on the created object with params [<object>] _isGlobalFunction BOOL Whether the executed function should be executed on all connected machine, false to execute only on the server Returns: NOTHING */

BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_hasMissionStarted.description: /* Author: Nelson Duarte Description: Returns whether the mission has actually started (see Manager) Parameters: Nothing Returns: True if mission was started, false if not */

BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_IFF.description: Simple handling of the Support Team's scripted IFF.

BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_manager.description: /* Author: Nelson Duarte Description: Handles match start synchronization between server and clients The following states are valid: - Waiting : State is set when joining the mission - Intro : State is set when mission intro starts - Loadout : State is set when mission loadout selection starts - Started : State is set when mission gameplay starts Parameters: _introVideos: The videos directory to play, empty array leads to skipping intro videos completely _introVideosSubtitles: The subtitles files to execute for intro videos _minWaitDelay: The time to wait after waiting has been completed _minLoadoutDelay: The time to wait after loadout has been completed _maxWaitDelay: The maximum time to wait for all players during the waiting, if reached, mission is forced onto next state _maxLoadoutDelay: The maximum time to wait for all players during the loadout, mission is forced onto next state _bWantsLoadoutSelection: Whether or not to go into loadout selection, if false this is skipped _bNoCinematics: Whether to force no cinematics, these need to be handled manually then Returns: Nothing */

BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_manager_getState.description: /* Author: Nelson Duarte Description: Get's the mission state, can be one of "Waiting", "Intro", "Loadout" or "Started" Parameters: Nothing Returns: The mission state */
